drive.DriveApp.name: DriveApp
drive.DriveApp.doc: Allows scripts to create, find, and modify files and folders in Google Drive.

property.name: Access
property.doc: An enum representing classes of users who can access a file or folder, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

property.name: Permission
property.doc: An enum representing the permissions granted to users who can access a file or folder, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

method.name: addFile
method.doc: Adds the given file to the root of the user's Drive.

argument.name: child
argument.doc: the child file to add

method.name: addFolder
method.doc: Adds the given folder to the root of the user's Drive.

argument.name: child
argument.doc: the child folder to add

method.name: continueFileIterator
method.doc: Resumes a file iteration using a continuation token from a previous iterator.

argument.name: continuationToken
argument.doc: a continuation token from a previous file iterator

method.name: continueFolderIterator
method.doc: Resumes a folder iteration using a continuation token from a previous iterator.

argument.name: continuationToken
argument.doc: a continuation token from a previous folder iterator

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a file in the root of the user's Drive from a given Blob of arbitrary data.

argument.name: blob
argument.doc: the data for the new file

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a text file in the root of the user's Drive with the given name and contents.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new file

argument.name: content
argument.doc: the content for the new file

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a file in the root of the user's Drive with the given name, contents, and MIME type.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new file

argument.name: content
argument.doc: the content for the new file

argument.name: mimeType
argument.doc: the MIME type of the new file

method.name: createFolder
method.doc: Creates a folder in the root of the user's Drive with the given name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new folder

method.name: getFileById
method.doc: Gets the file with the given ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the file

method.name: getFiles
method.doc: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive.

method.name: getFilesByName
method.doc: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that have the given name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the files to find

method.name: getFilesByType
method.doc: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that have the given MIME type.

argument.name: mimeType
argument.doc: the MIME type of the files to find

method.name: getFolderById
method.doc: Gets the folder with the given ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the folder

method.name: getFolders
method.doc: Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive.

method.name: getFoldersByName
method.doc: Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive that have the given name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the folders to find

method.name: getRootFolder
method.doc: Gets the folder at the root of the user's Drive.

method.name: getStorageLimit
method.doc: Gets the number of bytes the user is allowed to store in Drive.

method.name: getStorageUsed
method.doc: Gets the number of bytes the user is currently storing in Drive.

method.name: getTrashedFiles
method.doc: Gets a collection of all the files in the trash of the user's Drive.

method.name: getTrashedFolders
method.doc: Gets a collection of all the folders in the trash of the user's Drive.

method.name: removeFile
method.doc: Removes the given file from the root of the user's Drive.

argument.name: child
argument.doc: the child file to remove

method.name: removeFolder
method.doc: Removes the given folder from the root of the user's Drive.

argument.name: child
argument.doc: the child folder to remove

method.name: searchFiles
method.doc: Gets a collection of all files in the user's Drive that match the given search criteria.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: the search criteria, as detailed in the Google Drive SDK documentation

method.name: searchFolders
method.doc: Gets a collection of all folders in the user's Drive that match the given search criteria.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: the search criteria, as detailed in the Google Drive SDK documentation

drive.File.name: File
drive.File.doc: A file in Google Drive. Files can be accessed or created from DriveApp.

method.doc: Add the given user to the list of commenters for the File.

argument.doc: the email address of the user to add

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getDateCreated
method.doc: Gets the date the File was created.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Gets the description for the File.

method.name: getDownloadUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL that can be used to download the file.

method.name: getEditors
method.doc: Gets the list of editors for this File.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Gets the ID of the File.

method.name: getLastUpdated
method.doc: Gets the date the File was last updated.

method.name: getMimeType
method.doc: Gets the MIME type of the file.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Gets the name of the File.

method.name: getOwner
method.doc: Gets the owner of the File.

method.name: getParents
method.doc: Gets a collection of folders that are immediate parents of the File.

method.name: getSharingAccess
method.doc: Gets which class of users can access the File, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

method.name: getSharingPermission
method.doc: Gets the permission granted to those users who can access the File, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

method.name: getSize
method.doc: Gets the number of bytes used to store the File in Drive.

method.name: getThumbnail
method.doc: Gets a thumbnail image for the file, or null if no thumbnail exists.

method.name: getUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL that can be used to open the File in a Google App like Drive or Docs.

method.name: getViewers
method.doc: Gets the list of viewers and commenters for this File.

method.name: isShareableByEditors
method.doc: Determines whether users with edit permissions to the File are allowed to share with other users or change the permissions.

method.name: isStarred
method.doc: Determines whether the File has been starred in the user's Drive.

method.name: isTrashed
method.doc: Determines whether the File is in the trash of the user's Drive.

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Creates a copy of the file.

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Creates a copy of the file in the destination directory.

argument.name: destination
argument.doc: the directory to copy the file into.

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Creates a copy of the file and names it with the name provided.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the filename that should be applied to the new copy

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Creates a copy of the file in the destination directory and names it with the name provided.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the filename that should be applied to the new copy

argument.name: destination
argument.doc: the directory to copy the file into.

method.doc: Overwrites the content of the file with a given replacement.

argument.doc: the new content for the file

method.doc: Sets the description for the File.

argument.name: description
argument.doc: the new description for the File

method.doc: Sets the name of the File.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the new name of the File

method.name: setOwner
method.doc: Changes the owner of the File.

argument.name: emailAddress

method.name: setOwner
method.doc: Changes the owner of the File.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user who should become the new owner

method.name: setShareableByEditors
method.doc: Sets whether users with edit permissions to the File are allowed to share with other users or change the permissions.

argument.name: shareable
argument.doc: true if users with edit permissions should be allowed to share with other users or change the permissions; false if not

method.name: setSharing
method.doc: Sets which class of users can access the File and what permissions those users are granted, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access.

argument.name: accessType
argument.doc: which class of users should be able to access the File

argument.name: permissionType
argument.doc: the permissions that should be granted to users who can access the File

method.doc: Sets whether the File is starred in the user's Drive.

argument.name: starred
argument.doc: true if the File should be starred in the user's Drive; false if not

method.name: setTrashed
method.doc: Sets whether the File is in the trash of the user's Drive.

argument.name: trashed
argument.doc: true if the File should be moved to the trash of the user's Drive; false if not

drive.FileIterator.name: FileIterator
drive.FileIterator.doc: An iterator that allows scripts to iterate over a potentially large collection of files. File iterators can be acccessed from DriveApp or a Folder.

method.name: getContinuationToken
method.doc: Gets a token that can be used to resume this iteration at a later time.

method.name: hasNext
method.doc: Determines whether calling next() will return an item.

method.name: next
method.doc: Gets the next item in the collection of files or folders.

drive.FolderIterator.name: FolderIterator
drive.FolderIterator.doc: An object that allows scripts to iterate over a potentially large collection of folders. Folder iterators can be acccessed from DriveApp, a File, or a Folder.

drive.User.name: User
drive.User.doc: A user associated with a file in Google Drive. Users can be accessed from File.getEditors(), Folder.getViewers(), and other methods.

method.name: getDomain
method.doc: Gets the domain name associated with the user's account.

method.name: getEmail
method.doc: Gets the user's email address.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Gets the user's name.

method.name: getPhotoUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL for the user's photo.

drive.Access.name: Access
drive.Access.doc: An enum representing classes of users who can access a file or folder, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access. These properties can be accessed from DriveApp.Access.

property.name: ANYONE
property.doc: Anyone on the Internet can find and access. No sign-in required. Domain administrators can prohibit this setting for users of a G Suite domain. If the setting is disabled, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: ANYONE_WITH_LINK
property.doc: Anyone who has the link can access. No sign-in required. Domain administrators can prohibit this setting for users of a G Suite domain. If the setting is disabled, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: DOMAIN
property.doc: People in your domain can find and access. Sign-in required. This setting is available only for users of a G Suite domain. For other types of Google accounts, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: DOMAIN_WITH_LINK
property.doc: People in your domain who have the link can access. Sign-in required. This setting is available only for users of a G Suite domain. For other types of Google accounts, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: PRIVATE
property.doc: Only people explicitly granted permission can access. Sign-in required.

drive.Permission.name: Permission
drive.Permission.doc: An enum representing the permissions granted to users who can access a file or folder, besides any individual users who have been explicitly given access. These properties can be accessed from DriveApp.Permission.

property.name: VIEW
property.doc: Users who can access the file or folder are able only to view it or copy it. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

property.name: EDIT
property.doc: Users who can access the file or folder are able to edit it. Unless File.setShareableByEditors(shareable) is set to false, users can also change the sharing settings. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

property.name: COMMENT
property.doc: Users who can access the file or folder are able only to view it, copy it, or comment on it. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

property.name: OWNER
property.doc: The user owns the file or folder. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: ORGANIZER
property.doc: Users who can organize files and folders within a Team Drive. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

property.name: NONE
property.doc: The user does not have any permissions for the file or folder. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception unless it is set in combination with Access.ANYONE.
